translations.translation: Dark-eyed, secluded in cool pavilions.
Houris cloistered in pavilions --
There shall be maidens sheltered in tents.
- with big, black and white beautiful eyes, dwelling in tents.
They are houris (maidens of Paradise), hidden from view, in pavilions.
Hur (beautiful, fair females) guarded in pavilions;
Pure ones confined to the pavilions.
houris, cloistered in cool pavilions --
Fair ones, close-guarded in pavilions -
[There the blessed will live with their] pure companions sheltered in pavilions.
Fair ones, confined in tents.
Houris secluded in pavilions.
Companions restrained (as to their glances), in (goodly) pavilions;-
Houris (beautiful, fair females) restrained in pavilions;
Maidens (of Paradise, Houris) in cloistered cool pavilions.
Companions, secluded in the tents.
Fair ones reserved in pavilions -

[55:72] Houris (hur, this means maidens with intense black eyes set against the [intense] whiteness [of the iris]) secluded, concealed, in pavilions, made of studded gems, annexed to the palaces, like boudoirs.
Fair ones, close-guarded) for their husbands (in pavilions) of hollowed pearls.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { حُورٌ مَّقْصُورَاتٌ فِي ٱلْخِيَامِ } واحدُها حَوراءُ وهي الشَّديدةُ بياض، بياض العَينِ
 والشَّديدةَ سواد، سَواد العَينِ ومقصوراتٌ أي مخدورات
 في الخِيامِ: المَنازلَ

translations.translation:
And the saying of Allah: {Hurun Muqsaratu fi al-Khayam} One of them is Hurayah and she is the strong one, white, white of eye.


And the strong black, black of the eye and {mukhdiratun}, any {mukhdurah}.


At night: the mansions.
